dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, uh, this big 'peace agreement' between Armenia and Azerbaijan? Is that, like, even real, or just another headline?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, uh, this big 'peace agreement' between Armenia and Azerbaijan? Is that, like, even real, or just another headline?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, I mean, President Tokayev certainly thinks it is. He just met with the Armenian Foreign Minister, Mirzoyan, in Astana. And, like, he welcomed the completion of negotiations.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, I mean, President Tokayev certainly thinks it is. He just met with the Armenian Foreign Minister, Mirzoyan, in Astana. And, like, he welcomed the completion of negotiations.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: President of Kazakhstan Kassym-Jomart Tokayev received Armenian Foreign Minister Ararat Mirzoyan, according to a statement from Akorda. ... President Tokayev stated that Kazakhstan welcomes the completion of negotiations on the draft peace agreement and the establishment of interstate relations between Yerevan and Baku.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Tokayev welcomed it. Okay. But, uh, what does that actually mean? Is Kazakhstan suddenly, like, the big regional peacemaker here?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Tokayev welcomed it. Okay. But, uh, what does that actually mean? Is Kazakhstan suddenly, like, the big regional peacemaker here?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: He said it'll pave the way for lasting peace, you know, and security for the whole region. Between Armenia and Azerbaijan, but also, um, strengthening cooperation with Central Asia.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He said it'll pave the way for lasting peace, you know, and security for the whole region. Between Armenia and Azerbaijan, but also, um, strengthening cooperation with Central Asia.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to him, this milestone event will pave the way for lasting peace between Armenia and Azerbaijan and will contribute to strengthening security and fostering cooperation in the region, both with Kazakhstan and other Central Asian countries.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: "Pave the way." Right. And, like, we've heard that before, haven't we? What's Kazakhstan's actual stake in this, anyway? Besides, uh, just looking good?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pave the way. Right. And, like, we've heard that before, haven't we? What's Kazakhstan's actual stake in this, anyway? Besides, uh, just looking good?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, they've been boosting relations with Armenia. Tokayev said the mutual presidential visits last year, uh, gave a "significant boost." They, like, have respect for the Armenian people.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, they've been boosting relations with Armenia. Tokayev said the mutual presidential visits last year, uh, gave a significant boost. They, like, have respect for the Armenian people.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kassym-Jomart Tokayev noted that the mutual visits of the presidents last year gave a significant boost to the comprehensive development of Kazakh-Armenian relations. ... "We have great respect for the Armenian people and your country," the President emphasized.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: "Respect." Sure. Is that why Tokayev also announced Kazakhstan is ready to increase supplies to Armenia by, what, $350 million? Sounds more like, uh, business than brotherhood.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Respect. Sure. Is that why Tokayev also announced Kazakhstan is ready to increase supplies to Armenia by, what, three hundred fifty dollars million? Sounds more like, uh, business than brotherhood.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The President of Kazakhstan announced that domestic businesses are ready to increase supplies to Armenia by $350 million.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But that's part of the, um, "strategic partnership" Mirzoyan mentioned. They're discussing trade, investment, transport, cultural stuff too. It's comprehensive, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But that's part of the, um, strategic partnership Mirzoyan mentioned. They're discussing trade, investment, transport, cultural stuff too. It's comprehensive, you know?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: "We share your vision of strategic partnership between our countries in many ways," said Ararat Mirzoyan. ... During the meeting, the sides discussed prospects for developing bilateral relations in trade, investment, transport, and logistics, as well as cultural and humanitarian cooperation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Comprehensive. Or, like, trying to find new markets and, uh, influence. Are we really supposed to believe this isn't about, you know, shifting alliances or something?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Comprehensive. Or, like, trying to find new markets and, uh, influence. Are we really supposed to believe this isn't about, you know, shifting alliances or something?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Mirzoyan thanked them for the warm welcome. He, uh, said they share a vision for partnership. The foreign ministries are working on implementing agreements from Tokayev's visit.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Mirzoyan thanked them for the warm welcome. He, uh, said they share a vision for partnership. The foreign ministries are working on implementing agreements from Tokayev's visit.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In turn, the Armenian diplomat expressed his gratitude for the warm welcome. "We share your vision of strategic partnership between our countries in many ways," said Ararat Mirzoyan. He added that the foreign ministries and other agencies of Armenia and Kazakhstan are working on implementing the agreements reached during Kassym-Jomart Tokayev's official visit to Yerevan last year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: "Warm welcome." Right. Listen, countries always say that. But what about, um, the specifics? Is this peace deal, like, actually signed? Or still just "negotiations completed"?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Warm welcome. Right. Listen, countries always say that. But what about, um, the specifics? Is this peace deal, like, actually signed? Or still just negotiations completed?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: The article says it was reported earlier that Azerbaijan and Armenia had agreed on a peace deal. So, uh, yes, it seems to be moving forward.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The article says it was reported earlier that Azerbaijan and Armenia had agreed on a peace deal. So, uh, yes, it seems to be moving forward.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Earlier, it was reported that Azerbaijan and Armenia had agreed on a peace deal.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: "Seems to be moving forward." So not, like, actually done then. And Kazakhstan is just, uh, jumping in to claim some credit before the ink's even dry?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Seems to be moving forward. So not, like, actually done then. And Kazakhstan is just, uh, jumping in to claim some credit before the ink's even dry?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I think, um, they're just highlighting their role in, you know, regional stability.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I think, um, they're just highlighting their role in, you know, regional stability.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Or just, uh, looking for new leverage. You know. That's usually how these things go.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Or just, uh, looking for new leverage. You know. That's usually how these things go.
